column1: The Rakovník Brewery was founded in 1454. It is one of the oldest breweries in the Czech Republic. The beers are marketed under the brand Bakalář.
The centre of the town is historically significant and is protected by law as Urban monument zone. Its main feature is the 400 metre-long Hus Square
column2: which is the 2nd longest square in the Czech Republic. On the square is located the 16th-century town hall with a late Baroque façade. The interior of the town hall is decorated with a ceiling fresco depicting the town of Rakovník as it was 250 years ago.

column1: The eastern part of the square is dominated by the high Gothic Decanal Church of St. Bartholomew
